item.title: A person's faith and belief system is central in recovery from trauma. When faith leaders perpetrate violence, participate in violence or in a cover-up, when they address violence poorly or not at all, survivors' very belief systems and spirituality is deeply harmed. How can a survivor make meaning of their experiences when their understanding of the world has been turned upside down?
